Name: Defensive Shield
BattleEffect: The user summons ten defensive platelets that hover around either their selected target (which can be themselves), or their side of the field. These platelets are typed based on one of the user's types, of their choice. The platelets will reduce incoming damage to the selected target(s) by 25% and will lose a number of platelets for each attack that has its damage reduced. The number of platelets lost is dependent on type effectiveness of the attack versus the type of the platelets, with a neutral attack destroying two platelets, a super effective attack destroying three platelets, a resisted attack destroying one platelet, and an immune attack not destroying any platelets. Additionally, if the platelets are surrounding the user's side of the field and the blocked attack is a multi-target attack, one additional platelet will be lost, regardless of typing. If the user is holding a Light Clay, the number of summoned platelets is increased to fifteen.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

SecondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Speed two stages.

Name: Struggle
BattleEffect: This attack is used in desperation only if the user has no PP. It also damages the user a little.
SecondaryEffect: Damages user equal to 25% of maximum Hit Points

Name: Struggle Bug
BattleEffect: While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon. This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.
SecondaryEffect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

Name: Stuff Cheeks
BattleEffect: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.
SecondaryEffect: Raises user's Defense two stages.

Name: Stun Spore
BattleEffect: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.
SecondaryEffect: Induces Paralysis

Name: Submission
BattleEffect: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. This also damages the user a little.
SecondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

Name: Substitute
BattleEffect: The user creates a substitute for itself using some of its HP. The substitute serves as the user's decoy.
SecondaryEffect: Creates a decoy using 1/4 of the user's maximum HP.

Name: Subzero Slammer
BattleEffect: The user dramatically drops the temperature using its Z-Power and freezes the target with full force. The power varies, depending on the original move.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Sucker Punch
BattleEffect: This move enables the user to attack first. This move fails if the target is not readying an attack.
SecondaryEffect: Damages the opponent only if they are intending to use a damaging move. Fails if used after the opponent moves.

Name: Sunblock
BattleEffect: The user creates a protective, white barrier around either itself or a chosen ally. This barrier neutralizes the harmful effects of the Harsh Sunlight weather condition. This will protect the target from having their water-type moves deal reduced damage, any damage from the Dry Skin or Solar Power abilities, accuracy loss for their Hurricane and Thunder Moves, and neutralizes the boost oncoming fire-type moves get. Sunblock only lasts while in the sun, can only be used in the sun, and can be broken by Brick Break.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Sunny Day
BattleEffect: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of Water-type moves.
SecondaryEffect: Causes Sunshine for 5 turns

Name: Sunshower
BattleEffect: The user rains down brilliant beams or dazzling sunlight onto all adjacent foes, scorching them with blinding radiance. Has a 10% chance of inflicting Burn onto the foe.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Sunsteel Strike
BattleEffect: The user slams into the target with the force of a meteor. This move can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.
SecondaryEffect: Ignores abilities

Name: Super Fang
BattleEffect: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This cuts the target's HP in half.
SecondaryEffect: Cuts the opponent's Hit Points by 50% of the current value

Name: Superpower
BattleEffect: The user attacks the target with great power. However, this also lowers the user's Attack and Defense stats.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers user's Attack and Defense one stage.

Name: Supersonic
BattleEffect: The user generates odd sound waves from its body that confuse the target.
SecondaryEffect: Induces Confusion

Name: Supersonic Skystrike
BattleEffect: The user soars up with its Z-Power and plummets toward the target at full speed. The power varies, depending on the original move.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Surf
BattleEffect: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
SecondaryEffect: May damage diving opponents

Name: Surging Strikes
BattleEffect: The user, having mastered the Water style, strikes the target with a flowing motion three times in a row. This attack always results in a critical hit.
SecondaryEffect: Always inflicts a Critical Hit

Name: Swagger
BattleEffect: The user enrages and confuses the target. However, this also sharply raises the target's Attack stat.
SecondaryEffect: Induces Confusion. Raises opponent's Attack two stages.

Name: Swallow
BattleEffect: The power stored using the move Stockpile is absorbed by the user to heal its HP. Storing more power heals more HP.
SecondaryEffect: Absorbs power from STOCKPILE and recovers HP.

Name: Sweet Kiss
BattleEffect: The user kisses the target with a sweet, angelic cuteness that causes confusion.
SecondaryEffect: Induces Confusion

Name: Sweet Scent
BattleEffect: A sweet scent that harshly lowers opposing Pokémon's evasiveness.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Evasion two stages.

Name: Swift
BattleEffect: Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.
SecondaryEffect: Cannot miss.

Name: Switcheroo
BattleEffect: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.
SecondaryEffect: Switches items with the opponent

Name: Swords Dance
BattleEffect: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user's Attack stat.
SecondaryEffect: Raises user's Attack two stages.

Name: Synchronoise
BattleEffect: Using an odd shock wave, the user inflicts damage on any Pokémon of the same type in the area around it.
SecondaryEffect: Only damages Pokémon of the same type as the user.

Name: Synthesis
BattleEffect: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
SecondaryEffect: User restores HP.

Name: Tackle
BattleEffect: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Tail Glow
BattleEffect: The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.
SecondaryEffect: Raises user's Special Attack three stages.

Name: Tail Slap
BattleEffect: The user attacks by striking the target with its hard tail. It hits the target two to five times in a row.
SecondaryEffect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Name: Tail Whip
BattleEffect: The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Defense one stage.

Name: Tailwind
BattleEffect: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups the Speed stats of the user and its allies for four turns.
SecondaryEffect: Increases Speed of all user's Pokémon for four turns by two stages.
ZMovePowerOrEffect: Increases Critical Hit Ratio by 2 stages

Name: Take Down
BattleEffect: A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. This also damages the user a little.
SecondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

Name: Take Heart
BattleEffect: The user lifts its spirits, healing its own status conditions and raising its offensive and defensive stats.
SecondaryEffect: Clear Status, +1 Atk/Def/SpAtk/SpDef

Name: Tar Shot
BattleEffect: The user pours sticky tar over the target, lowering the target's Speed stat. The target becomes weaker to Fire-type moves.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers target's Speed stat by 1 stage. Target receives  more damage from Fire-type moves

Name: Taunt
BattleEffect: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.
SecondaryEffect: The opponent can only use damaging moves for three turns

Name: Tearful Look
BattleEffect: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers target's Attack & Special Attack stats by 1 stage

Name: Teatime
BattleEffect: The user has teatime with all the Pokémon in the battle. Each Pokémon eats its held Berry.
SecondaryEffect: Causes all Pokémon to activate their Berry

Name: Techno Blast
BattleEffect: The user fires a beam of light at its target. The move's type changes depending on the Drive the user holds.
SecondaryEffect: Changes the type of the move based upon the item being held

Name: Tectonic Rage
BattleEffect: The user burrows deep into the ground and slams into the target with the full force of its Z-Power. The power varies, depending on the original move.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Teeter Dance
BattleEffect: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses the Pokémon around it.
SecondaryEffect: Confuses all Pokémon on the field.

Name: Telekinesis
BattleEffect: The user makes the target float with its psychic power. The target is easier to hit for three turns.
SecondaryEffect: Gives the target Ground-type resistance. Removes Evasion stat for target.

Name: Teleport
BattleEffect: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting, if any. If a wild Pokémon uses this move, it flees.
SecondaryEffect: Ends wild battles.
ZMovePowerOrEffect: Heals the Hit Points of this Pokémon

Name: Terrain Pulse
BattleEffect: The user utilizes the power of the terrain to attack. This move's type and power changes depending on the terrain when it's used.
SecondaryEffect: Becomes the type of Terrain and doubles in power

Name: Thief
BattleEffect: The user attacks and steals the target's held item simultaneously. The user can't steal anything if it already holds an item.
SecondaryEffect: May steal opponent's item (temporarily in trainer battles).

Name: Thorns
BattleEffect: The user embeds the opponent with a flurry of stinging thorns, which embed into the target. Once embedded, the opponent will be under the condition Thorns and will receive damage over time (about 1/16th of their health per turn) while affected until cured or fainted. Status can be cured by using Rapid Spin. Grass-type Pokemon are immune to the effect. This is considered a volatile status condition.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Thousand Arrows
BattleEffect: This move also hits opposing Pokémon that are in the air. Those Pokémon are knocked down to the ground.
SecondaryEffect: Ignores Ground-type Resistance. Knocks Flying/Levitating Pokémon to the ground.

Name: Thousand Waves
BattleEffect: The user attacks with a wave that crawls along the ground. Those it hits can't flee from battle.
SecondaryEffect: Prevents target from switching

Name: Thrash
BattleEffect: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
SecondaryEffect: User uses the same Attack for 2-3 turns then becomes confused.

Name: Throat Chop
BattleEffect: The user attacks the target's throat, and the resultant suffering prevents the target from using moves that emit sound for two turns.
SecondaryEffect: Prevents target from using Sound moves for 2 turns

Name: Thunder
BattleEffect: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: May induce Paralysis.  Damages Pokémon using Fly, Bounce or Sky Drop

Name: Thunder Cage
BattleEffect: The user traps the target in a cage of sparking electricity for four to five turns.
SecondaryEffect: Traps the opponent for 4 to 5 turns

Name: Thunder Fang
BattleEffect: The user bites with electrified fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: May PARALYZE opponent or cause opponent to flinch.

Name: Thunder Punch
BattleEffect: The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

Name: Thunder Shock
BattleEffect: A jolt of electricity crashes down on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

Name: Thunder Wave
BattleEffect: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.
SecondaryEffect: Induces Paralysis

Name: Thunderbolt
BattleEffect: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

Name: Thunderous Kick
BattleEffect: The user overwhelms the target with lightning-like movement before delivering a kick. This also lowers the target's Defense stat.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Defense one stage.

Name: Tickle
BattleEffect: The user tickles the target into laughing, reducing its Attack and Defense stats.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack and Defense one stage.

Name: Topsy-Turvy
BattleEffect: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy-turvy and become the opposite of what they were.
SecondaryEffect: Inverts all stat alterations on the target.

Name: Torment
BattleEffect: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
SecondaryEffect: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.

Name: Toxic
BattleEffect: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
SecondaryEffect: Induces severe poison.

Name: Toxic Spikes
BattleEffect: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
SecondaryEffect: Sets spikes that POISON the opponent upon switching.

Name: Toxic Thread
BattleEffect: The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target's Speed stat.
SecondaryEffect: Inflicts Poison. Lowers opponent's Speed by 1 stage.

Name: Transform
BattleEffect: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.
SecondaryEffect: User transforms to the opponent.
ZMovePowerOrEffect: Heals the Hit Points of this Pokémon

Name: Tri Attack
BattleEffect: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. This may also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.
SecondaryEffect: May induce burn, freeze or paralysis.

Name: Trick
BattleEffect: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.
SecondaryEffect: Switches items with the opponent

Name: Trick Room
BattleEffect: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
SecondaryEffect: Inverts the turn order in each Speed Priority bracked for 5 turns.

Name: Trick-or-Treat
BattleEffect: The user takes the target trick-or-treating. This adds Ghost type to the target's type.
SecondaryEffect: Target gains the Ghost-type

Name: Triple Arrows
BattleEffect: The user delivers an axe kick, then fires three arrows. This raises the chance of its future attacks landing critical hits and also lowers the target's defensive stats.
SecondaryEffect: +Crit, -1 Def

Name: Triple Axel
BattleEffect: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.
SecondaryEffect: Base Power is 20 on the first hit, 40 on the second and 60 on the third

Name: Triple Kick
BattleEffect: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.
SecondaryEffect: Attacks 1-3 times in a row.

Name: Trop Kick
BattleEffect: The user lands an intense kick of tropical origins on the target. This also lowers the target's Attack stat.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack one stage.

Name: Trump Card
BattleEffect: The fewer PP this move has, the greater its power.
SecondaryEffect: Increases power the lower its PP

Name: Twineedle
BattleEffect: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison the target.
SecondaryEffect: Attacks twice. May induce poison.

Name: Twinkle Tackle
BattleEffect: The user creates a very charming space using its Z-Power and totally toys with the target. The power varies, depending on the original move.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Twister
BattleEffect: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.
SecondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch. Damage is doubled if opponent is using Fly.

Name: U-turn
BattleEffect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
SecondaryEffect: Pokémon switches out from battle

Name: Unfinished Symphony
BattleEffect: The user sings a haunting melody that causes a cloud of ghostly energy to swirl around the heads of all listeners. All Pokemon besides the user that hear this move will become confused, and take damage equivalent to Nightmare while confused. This effect ends when confusion is cleared, and this move is considered a Sound move.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Uproar
BattleEffect: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
SecondaryEffect: Hits for 3 turns. No Pokémon can be Asleep during that time.

Name: V-create
BattleEffect: With a hot flame on its forehead, the user hurls itself at its target. This lowers the user's Defense, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers user's Defense, Special Defense & Speed one stage.

Name: Vacuum Wave
BattleEffect: The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.
SecondaryEffect: Has increased Speed Priority

Name: Veevee Volley
BattleEffect: The more Eevee loves its Trainer, the greater the move’s power. It never misses.
SecondaryEffect: The happier the user, the stronger the Attack.

Name: Venom Drench
BattleEffect: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers opponent's Attack, Special Attack & Speed one stage if Poisoned.

Name: Venoshock
BattleEffect: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This move's power is doubled if the target is poisoned.
SecondaryEffect: Doubles damage inflicted if target is Poisoned

Name: Vice Grip
BattleEffect: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Victory Dance
BattleEffect: The user performs a dance to usher in victory. This raises the user's offensive and defensive stats and increases the damage dealt by the user's moves by 50 percent.
SecondaryEffect: +1 Atk/Def/Spd

Name: Vine Whip
BattleEffect: The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Vise Grip
BattleEffect: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Vital Throw
BattleEffect: The user attacks last. In return, this throw move never misses.
SecondaryEffect: Cannot miss. Goes last.

Name: Volt Switch
BattleEffect: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
SecondaryEffect: Pokémon switches out from battle

Name: Volt Tackle
BattleEffect: The user electrifies itself and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: User receives 1/3rd of damage in re-coil. May PARALYZE opponent.

Name: Voodoo Bugaloo
BattleEffect: The user expends a quarter of their maximum health to create a doll that is psychically linked to a targeted ally or opponent. Any damage the doll receives, and any stat changes or status conditions that are applied to the doll are applied to the target as well. Additionally, this doll will activate abilities of the target (i.e Flash Fire, Clear Body, Levitate, etc.). The doll lasts until it breaks and features the same durability and energy consumption as a Substitute doll. This doll is an additional target that can be targeted in raid battles and is counted as part of the user’s side of the field.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Wake-Up Slap
BattleEffect: This attack inflicts big damage on a sleeping target. This also wakes the target up, however.
SecondaryEffect: Heals the target from Sleep

Name: Water Gun
BattleEffect: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Water Pledge
BattleEffect: A column of water hits the target. When used with its fire equivalent, its power increases and a rainbow appears.
SecondaryEffect: If combined with Fire Oath, increases likelihood of Secondary Effects by 30% for four turns.

Name: Water Pulse
BattleEffect: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.
SecondaryEffect: May induce Confusion

Name: Water Shuriken
BattleEffect: The user hits the target with throwing stars two to five times in a row. This move always goes first.
SecondaryEffect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hitsBase Power increased to 20 if Battle Bond has activated and will hit 3 times guaranteed.

Name: Water Sport
BattleEffect: The user soaks the battlefield with water. This weakens Fire-type moves for five turns.
SecondaryEffect: Lowers the power of Fire-type moves used on this Pokémon

Name: Water Spout
BattleEffect: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.
SecondaryEffect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is high.

Name: Waterfall
BattleEffect: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.
SecondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

Name: Wave Crash
BattleEffect: The user shrouds itself in water and slams into the target with its whole body to inflict damage. This also damages the user and raises the user's action speed.
SecondaryEffect: Recoil [1/3rd inflicted], +1 Spd

Name: Weather Ball
BattleEffect: This attack move varies in power and type depending on the weather.
SecondaryEffect: Changes type and doubles power based on the weather in play

Name: Whirlpool
BattleEffect: The user traps the target in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.
SecondaryEffect: Traps the opponent for 4 to 5 turns

Name: Whirlwind
BattleEffect: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
SecondaryEffect: Ends wild battles.

Name: Wicked Blow
BattleEffect: The user, having mastered the Dark style, strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.
SecondaryEffect: Always inflicts a Critical Hit

Name: Wide Guard
BattleEffect: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
SecondaryEffect: Protects all Pokémon on your team from damage that'd hit both Pokémon for one turn

Name: Wild Charge
BattleEffect: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target. This also damages the user a little.
SecondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

Name: Wildbolt Storm
BattleEffect: The user summons a thunderous tempest and savagely attacks with lightning and wind. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: 30% Paralysis

Name: Will-O-Wisp
BattleEffect: The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict a burn.
SecondaryEffect: Induces burn.

Name: Wing Attack
BattleEffect: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Wish
BattleEffect: One turn after this move is used, the user's or its replacement's HP is restored by half the user's max HP.
SecondaryEffect: In 1 turn, it heals whatever Pokémon is in this position on the field's Hit Points by 50% of the maximum Hit Points.

Name: Withdraw
BattleEffect: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell, raising its Defense stat.
SecondaryEffect: Raises user's Defense one stage.

Name: Wonder Room
BattleEffect: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon's Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.
SecondaryEffect: Switches Defense & Special Defense for five turns for all Pokémon on the field

Name: Wood Hammer
BattleEffect: The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack. This also damages the user quite a lot.
SecondaryEffect: User takes recoil damage equal to a third of the damage inflicted.

Name: Work Up
BattleEffect: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.
SecondaryEffect: Raises user's Attack & Special Attack one stage.

Name: Worry Seed
BattleEffect: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target's Ability Insomnia.
SecondaryEffect: Changes the opponent's ability to Insomnia

Name: Wrap
BattleEffect: A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
SecondaryEffect: Traps opponent.

Name: Wring Out
BattleEffect: The user powerfully wrings the target. The more HP the target has, the greater the move's power.
SecondaryEffect: Increases damage the higher the target's Hit Points

Name: X-Scissor
BattleEffect: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
SecondaryEffect: No effect.

Name: Yawn
BattleEffect: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.
SecondaryEffect: Target falls asleep during the next turn.

Name: Zap Cannon
BattleEffect: The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict damage and cause paralysis.
SecondaryEffect: May induce paralysis.

Name: Zen Headbutt
BattleEffect: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.
SecondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

Name: Zing Zap
BattleEffect: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target, giving it an electric shock. This may also make the target flinch.
SecondaryEffect: May cause opponent to flinch.

Name: Zippy Zap
BattleEffect: The user attacks the target with bursts of electricity at high speed. This move always goes first and results in a critical hit.
SecondaryEffect: Always inflicts a Critical Hit
